been playing around with the Brave browser. got mixed feelings
never heard of it
sounds interesting though

<https://brave.com/how239>
(referral link, if you’re not wanting to send me BAT you can erase the referral part)
pay for a browser?
the idea behind it is intriguing with the whole - optionally see no ads, get paid to see ads that are served locally with no user data shared to do the targeting etc.
no it’s a free browser that pays you, and the websites you visit, that’s the concept
ok so if i use the one that i just downloaded you get rewarded BAT
yes if you use it for 30 days

but anyhow, the thing that I don’t like is unlike normal cryptocurrency, it’s a centralized cryptocurrency. basically. Because Brave built it into the browser, and made it so they control the only way to get BAT out of your browser and into another currency.

pretty much. you earn BAT for viewing ads. the ads are basically push notifications vs traditional ads. the idea is you earn money for seeing ads and give back to content creators that you enjoy. in a perfect world content creators could make more off ongoing donations than spamming their own ads across the web. and its all optional. you can choose to not see any ads or to not give back to content creators

on top of that, there are some ethical concerns too. For website owners, all your ads are blocked, all your tracking scripts are blocked by default. Users can tip you. Problem is. what if you DON’T want tips from your users. as a website owner you have to manually register and decline the tips. otherwise people’s BAT sits in limbo for 30 days
on top of that for website owners you’re inclined to keep the currency in BAT form because if you take it out of that there are potential tax problems
ya, i agree. there are a few things about it that arent great.
i love the model and think its a good first step
I agree, I think though they need a bit of tweaking.

but yea one area that sucks is say you own a website - You want to avoid the BAT tax reprecussions or, you feel you’re better paid through a different ad network. You no longer have a choice, because if users use Brave on your site, you lose analytics AND you lose ad views, costing you financially. It’s like the mafia providing “security” for a store
it could ironically kill advertising on the internet if it took off

I am a big fan though of giving browser users a free currency in exchange for browsing sites, and giving them mechanisms to financially help the sites they visit. Hopefully the majority of people don’t act greedy with it. Otherwise it will only have a negative effect on the web.
